title: confusing about mining
body:
NAME:
   geth.exe - the go-ethereum command line interface

   Copyright 2013-2022 The go-ethereum Authors

VERSION:
   1.10.18-unstable

I want to know why our mining address is always over 180% effort for 4 consecutive blocks, and now the 5th block is still over 180% or no block? I want you to check the mining data for us, is there any problem? Because the submitted verification work is Invalid proof-of-work submitted 

console output log：

Your remote sealers are always submitting invalid proof-of-work solution, you may want to check your miners?

`over 180% effort for 4 consecutive blocks` what do you mean by this?

> Your remote sealers are always submitting invalid proof-of-work solution, you may want to check your miners?
> 
> `over 180% effort for 4 consecutive blocks` what do you mean by this?
Since the work sent to me by the mainnet is too difficult, I will split it, so I don’t know if the invalid submission will have computing power on the mainnet. I want to know if the work I submitted is useful on the mainnet? The first 3 blocks are normal, and the mining computing power of the last 4 blocks exceeds 180% of the normal difficulty. Now the fifth block has exceeded the difficulty by more than 260%. 

Is there any way to check my mining computing power on the mainnet?
